analysis.heading: What counts as floor area summary
analysis.content:
Architectural feature, Counts?, Illustration

Porches & entry features:
Unenclosed porches - No
Enclosed porches - Once
Entry feature ≤ 12' in height - No
Entry feature > 12' in height - Twice (footprint)
1st floor recessed porches < 10' in depth and open on exterior side - No
2nd floor roofed or enclosed porches, arcades, balconies, porticos, breezeways - Once

Attics & equivalencies:
Attic space where floor to under side of roof rafter distance is < 5' - No
All 2nd floor space (including attics) where head height or distance from top of floor to bottom of rafter is ≥ 5' - Once
2nd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 17' - Twice
3rd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 26' - Three times
Exemption: 3rd floor equivalent, where roof pitch is ≥ 4:12 - 200 sf exempt
Exemption: Unusable attic space for Category 1 & 2 historic homes - 500 sf exempt

Basements:
Basements that comply with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070 - No
Basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district (even if > 3') - No

Other:
Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior flr, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows) - No
Architectural appendages like fireplace or buttress footprint - Once

Accessory structures:
Accessory structures >120 sf - Once
Garages and carports - Once
Porte cocheres - No
